list.title: 1 Rooftop Bar
list.description: The views of the East River, Brooklyn Bridge, and Manhattan skyline set this rooftop bar apart. Come on a summer afternoon to take advantage of the view.

list.title: Abraco
list.description: East Village coffee shop and bakery with outstanding espresso.

list.title: Ace Hotel Lobby Bar
list.description: The Ace Hotel lobby is no secret, but it does remain a nice place to get a drink in the evening or work during the day. The slightly cavernous space is a nice change for New York City with lots of cozy spots to settle into.

list.title: Achilles Heel
list.description: Small corner bar in Greenpoint from the owner of Diner. The limited menu is predictably excellent too.

list.title: Alameda
list.description: Stylish bar in a quiet area of Greenpoint with outdoor seating. Combined with a raw bar and cocktail menu it makes for a nice day-drinking spot.

list.title: Amor Y Amargo
list.description: Tiny Alphabet City bar offering cocktails based on bitters. Friendly bartenders will help novices find their own bitter truth.

list.title: Apotheke
list.description: Fun yet sophisticated cocktail bar modeled on an apothecary. The rooftop herb garden is a source for their cocktails, which they call 'prescriptions.'

list.title: Baby's All Right
list.description: Williamsburg live music bar with brunch on the weekends. The retro-kitsch interior complements the cocktail menu.

list.title: Bar Room at the Beekman
list.description: Spectacular cocktail bar in FiDi. On weeknights in can get busy from the after-work crowd so get in early!

list.title: Bar Beau
list.hours: Mon: 8am-4pm | Tues, Wed, Sun: 8am-12am | Thurs, Fri, Sat: 8am-2am
list.description: Williamsburg coffee shop-by-day and cocktail bar in the evening. The minimalist design and concrete floors elevate this bar and separate it from the sameness of everywhere else.

list.title: Bemelmans Bar
list.description: Classic cocktail bar located in The Carlyle Hotel. The walls are painted by Ludwig Bemelmans, who worked for The New Yorker and Vogue, and illustrated the Madeline children's books. The live music will transport you to another time.

list.title: Birdland
list.description: Classic jazz club near Times Square. Table service and top local and out-of-town talent make this one of the best spots to see jazz in New York.

list.title: Black Crescent
list.description: Lower East Side cocktail bar with a food menu. A calmer and more sophisticated alternative to the other choices in the area.

list.title: Black Mountain Wine House
list.description: Unique place to have a glass of wine in Carroll Gardens. Made to feel like a log cabin, settle in and relax with a glass of wine near the fireplace.

list.title: Bossa Nova Civic Club
list.description: No-frills bar in Bushwick to bring your friends on the weekend and dance all night.

list.title: Brooklyn Inn
list.description: Tucked away in a residential street of Boerum Hill, the old-world charm and English pub vibe make for a great neighborhood spot.

list.title: Caffe Dante
list.description: A reinvention of the original bar, the new owners have honored its legacy with a retro interior and cocktail list. They also serve a full menu and brunch.

list.title: Caffe Marchio
list.description: This has to be one of the best places to get coffee in Manhattan. Located in the Redbury Hotel, it's owned by Danny Meyer.

list.title: Daddy-O
list.description: Neighborhood bar with a winning combination of delicious food, quality drinks, nice atmosphere, and sports on multiple televisions.

list.title: Dead Rabbit
list.description: Three-story cocktail bar with old-world charm. Top pick for after-work drinks with a colleague in FiDi.

list.title: Donna
list.description: Still one of our favorite bars in New York despite the secret having been out for quite some time. Try the Solar Hex cocktail!

list.title: Downing Street Bar
list.description: Ultimate date-night bar because it's romantic, not cheesy. The tiny bar is not a great place to come with more than one person anyway.

list.title: Dutch Kills
list.street address: 27-24 Jackson Ave, Long Island City, NY 11101
list.description: It would be hard to speak too highly of this LIC cocktail bar. The space is stunning and has many private nooks, the drinks are fantastic, and the service is friendly. Take someone you want to impress!

list.title: Evening Bar
list.street address: Smyth Hotel, 85 W Broadway, New York, NY 10007
list.description: Located inside The Smyth Hotel, Evening Bar is welcoming and under-the-radar so you're almost guaranteed to get a seat.

list.title: Extra Fancy
list.description: Williamsburg bar with outdoor seating and a New England menu of clam bakes and lobster rolls. Perfect for drinking the Sunday scaries away with your friends.

list.title: George Washington Bar
list.description: Sophisticated cocktail bar clad in dark wood inside the Freehand Hotel.

list.title: Fresh Kills
list.description: Intimate cocktail bar in Williamsburg from the same bartenders as Dutch Kills. Come while you wait (endlessly) for a table at Misi!

list.title: Gallow Green
list.description: Gallow Green is an actually good rooftop bar in Chelsea. As part of Sleep No More's McKittrick Hotel, the bar retains a theatrical feel.

list.title: Grand Army
list.description: The perfect neighborhood bar that somehow feels cozy in the winter and bright in the summer.

list.title: Henry Public
list.description: Quaint and homey cocktail bar where you can settle into the booths for hours.

list.title: Hotel Delmano
list.description: Handsome Williamsburg cocktail bar that's been a staple of the area for many years.

list.title: Jones Wood Foundry
list.description: British inspired bar in the Upper East Side with a full menu and multiple seating areas. You'll think you're in London.

list.title: June
list.description: Art nouveau style bar with a large food menu to enjoy with your glass of wine. June stands out in a city where many bars look the same.

list.title: Kinfolk 94
list.description: Multidisciplinary spaces ranging from a bar, dance party, and coffee shop by day.

list.title: Little Branch
list.description: Subterranean speakeasy in the West Village that often has live jazz. Best to come early if it's important for you to have a seat.

list.title: Loosie Rouge
list.description: Cocktail bar in South Williamsburg with low wood ceilings. Bring a date during the week or your friends on the weekend!

list.title: Maison Premiere
list.description: Beautiful room, outdoor seating, delicious raw bar, excellent cocktails…Not much else to say about this New Orleans style bar.

list.title: Manderley Bar
list.description: There's an intoxicating ambience at this jazz bar. Though operating out of the McKittrick Hotel, it's open to the public.

list.title: Marie's Crisis
list.description: West Village piano bar where people sing Broadway show tunes. So. Much. Fun.

list.title: Mr. Fong's
list.description: Cocktail bar in Chinatown with an interesting menu. It's a little out of the action but we promise it's worth the trip.

list.title: NoMad Hotel Bar
list.description: Both the bars at the NoMad Hotel are highly recommended but only with the caveat that you will need to be willing to stand if you are coming after work on a week night.

list.title: Primo's
list.description: Vintage-inspired bar inside The Frederick hotel. The retro décor pairs well with the cocktail list.

list.title: Pulqueria
list.description: If you're looking for somewhere to dance, this China Town bar is one of our favorite places in the city!

list.title: Ramona
list.description: Bi-level cocktail bar in Greenpoint with many different areas to enjoy your drink. We love sitting at the huge marble bar and watching your drinks being made.

list.title: Spuyten Duyvil
list.description: Casual neighborhood bar since 2003. The classic space has a large wooden bar area to enjoy your drink.

list.title: St. Mazie
list.description: Williamsburg bar with live music and an outdoor area. There's also a restaurant downstairs if you're hungry!

list.title: Stumptown
list.description: Get caffeinated at the coffee roaster's large café in Cobble Hill. Lots of seating and space to work.

list.title: The Elk
list.description: West Village cafe with comfortable seating and a food menu.

list.title: The Flower Shop
list.description: Seventies-styled bar in the Lower East Side. A good option when you're in the neighborhood.

list.title: The Four Horsemen
list.description: Williamsburg bar with friendly servers to guide you through the wine list. The food is excellent too!

list.title: The Hoxton
list.description: The lobby bar can be anything you want — from a coffee meeting to catching up with a friend for a drink. The outdoor space is used both in summer and winter and the bar area serves classic American food. The rooftop bar, Summerly, has Manhattan views.

list.title: The Lobby Bar at Bowery Hotel
list.image: The Lobby Bar at Bowery Hotel
list.description: Cocktail bar with a fireplace and outdoor seating in the Bowery Hotel. Also a nice place to enjoy a coffee and read the paper in the lounge area.

list.title: The Office
list.description: Cocktail bar at the top of the Mandarin Oriental hotel. In a city where a lot of bars feel the same this one is both very Manhattan but somehow also not at all.

list.title: The Richardson
list.description: Located under the BQE, The Richardson is a cocktail bar that feels a little old world and like it's been there much longer than it has.

list.title: The Rum House
list.description: Jazz bar in a classic and cozy space in the midst of the Theater District mayhem. Come for a drink after a show!

list.title: The Topaz
list.description: Cocktail bar in Bushwick with live music, specialty cocktails, and delicious snacks in a vintage-inspired environment.

list.title: The Up and Up
list.description: Subterranean cocktail bar on a particularly fratty street of Greenwich Village, but don't let that put you off as this place is a gem and they have a no men approaching women policy.

list.title: The Wayland
list.description: Cocktail bar located in Alphabet City. There's often live music and it tends to get very loud so don't come for an intimate tete-a-tete.

list.title: Three Diamond Door
list.description: Bushwick bar with a large backyard to bring friends on the weekend.

list.title: Torst
list.description: Boutique beer bar — that looks like a cocktail bar — in Greenpoint. Good food list to complement their menu.

list.title: Village Vanguard
list.description: Classic jazz club in the West Village. An important part of New York's history.

list.title: Laughing Man
list.description: Small coffee shop in Tribeca with outdoor seating in the summer time. Try the honey lavender latte!

list.title: Little Collins
list.description: Located in an area you will probably find yourself wondering where to get a good coffee. The food menu is excellent too and includes vegemite on toast.

list.title: Reception Bar
list.description: Lower East Side cocktail bar using Korean ingredients and a menu of small plates in a light-filled space.

list.title: Honey's
list.description: Drink cocktails and meads in this large Bushwick bar. They have a snack menu too.
